intro: Guardiola stenodonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved guardiola, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat requirements, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
